title: How did you become an audiobook narrator for Audible? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m an actor and decided I wanted to get into voice overwork. I trained and began auditioning for VO jobs. Actors are prepared to voice different characters so they’re an automatic choice to do audiobook work. I began auditioning for authors and or publishers to narrate their audiobooks. I taught myself how to edit and master to Audible specs (this wasn’t easy!). I landed my first big job through a freelancer site for an indie author. She went on to write many books about Wicca and I was the designated narrator for the entire series. You don’t narrate for Audible although they designate certain narrators as approved. You’re really narrating for the author or publisher who then uploads the audiobook to Audible.
